content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code snippet for your request. 

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[Symbol("dt")], "yyyymm")
    return df
end
```
In this code, the function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame and adds a new column (`:ym`) to it. The content of this new column is generated by formatting the original date-time column (`df[:dt]`) using the "yyyymm" format string which represents the year and month in the DateType format.
